definition: to abscond/to be absent without leave
without authority/to usurp/to arrogate to oneself/to monopolize/expert in/to be good at
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: He stained his military record by going AWOL [a.w.o.l.=absent without official leave].
sentences.chinese: 他因擅離職守而玷污了軍績。

sentences.english: Leave work area without taking safe measure, cause company significant loss.
sentences.chinese: 擅離職守，致公司蒙受重大損失者。

sentences.english: Be away from duties without the of a superior officer.
sentences.chinese: 軍人咱未獲上級軍嘿允許的情麗下擅離職守。

sentences.english: He enticed me away from work.
sentences.chinese: 你不該引誘他擅離職守。

sentences.english: Working hours shall not be absent from duty or leave early.
sentences.chinese: 工作時間不得擅離職守或早退。

sentences.english: The soldier deserted from his post.
Monks5 loved playing tennis so much that they would skip out on their duties at the monasteries.
sentences.chinese: 僧侶十分喜歡打網球，以至於在修道院中擅離職守。

sentences.english: Working time may not leave his position without authorization or leave early.
sentences.chinese: 工作時間不得擅離職守或早退。

sentences.english: You must not leave your post without permission .
Any soldier failing to report would be considered absent without leave and punished accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 士兵若未報到將被視爲擅離職守而受處分。

sentences.english: Monks loved playing tennis so much that they would skip out on their duties at the monasteries.
sentences.chinese: 僧侶十分喜歡打網球，以至於在修道院中擅離職守。
